value.title: Building relationships between tables when both have duplicates
value.excerpt: PowerPivot and Power BI Desktop only allow the creation of relationships between tables when one of columns forming the relationship does not have duplicate values. value.title: DAX Fridays! #41: LOOKUPVALUE with multiple columns
value.excerpt: In todays DAX Friday video, we will learn how to use the DAX Function called LOOKUPVALUE: Lookupvalue is very similar to excel's VLookup but there are some critical differences that you need to understand if you want to use it. value.title: Managing changing column names in Power Query #10: (M)agic (M)ondays

value.title: DAX Fridays! #3: SUM and SUMX
value.excerpt: Dax Fridays! Today we will go through: how to use SUM() and SUMX(), the difference between them and when should we use one vs the other.  The DAX SUM function calculates the sum of all numbers in a column while the DAX SUMX function returns the sum of an expression for each row in a table.  02:28 Create

value.title: DAX Fridays! #78: When should I use FILTER() with CALCULATE?
value.excerpt: When should you use the filter function with CALCULATE?
